bwwExcerpt: Jack O’Brien (Hairspray, Shucked) directs with a sure hand, and David Yazbek (The Band’s Visit) provides the woodwind-heavy incidental music. There’s no show without the stars — their staccato interplay is expert — and while Silverman’s play often feels like it might evaporate through those beams, it’s nice to spend time with these two old friends. If you can label them that!      Daniel D'Addario, Variety: In the main, “The Roommate” is a spirited entry on Broadway and a welcome showcase for Lu
